full_text: A pretty Oslo basket knitted in Woolpower and then felted in the washing machine. The base of the basket is knitted with double-pointed needles and then circular needles. The basket is both pretty and practical. Happy knitting! Materials: 2 skeins of 100 g Woolpower color 10 DPN and 32” Circular needles US 11 (8 mm) Measurements: Before Felting: Width- measured flat: 21 inches From starting point to top: 15 inches Height of the side: 7,5 inches After Felting: Width- measured flat: 13 inches Height of the side: 4 1⁄4 inches Gauge: 14 sts x 12 rows = 4” x 4” Pattern information: The bottom of the basket is knit on DPNs and switches to the circular needles once there are enough sts. It is knit in the round in garter stitch = knit 1 round, purl 1 round. Wash in a machine on hot cycle in order to felt. Abbreviation of increase stitch: M1 : ​​From the front, lift loop between stitches with left needle, knit into back of loop.
name: Ravelry: Oslo basket pattern by Sys Fredens
